isis.stitle: DT 466 / DT 570 / HT 570 Service Manual - 2004 Emissions with EGR - Crankcase, Crankshaft, and Camshaft - Installation - Cam Gear on Camshaft

warning.para: To avoid serious personal injury or possible death, wear heat resistant gloves when handling heated components.

step1.para: If the camshaft gear was removed from the camshaft, heat the cam gear on a hot plate or other controlled heat source to 149-177°C (300-350°F).

caution.para: To avoid engine damage, heating the cam gear beyond 177°C (350°F) will cause gear to turn blue and adversely effect its wear resistance. Do not use any gear that has turned blue from overheating.

step1.para: Pull camshaft assembly forward prior to sliding heated gear onto camshaft.

Use heat resistant gloves to install the heated cam gear onto the camshaft. The cam gear should slide onto the camshaft with only slight hand pressure. Hold the cam gear (while thoroughly seated) until it cools onto the camshaft (approximately 30 seconds).

note.para: Heated gear should easily slide onto camshaft. Do not tap into place to avoid camshaft end play issues. If gear does not slide easily, reheat gear and try again.
